page.title: 11 The Condition of Wootton.
page.content: Many people think that Wootton is a very pleasant place in which to live and bring up children but there are a number of concerns about the state of the village. There is a great deal of litter dropped and pavements and playing areas are fouled by dogs. Telephone boxes have been vandalised and part of the cemetery needs clearing. Some people are concerned about the safety of children on the roads and about the possibility of them being attacked at night. People are worried about the effect of developments in the area and the presence of the Barracks at times divides the population into army and village people.
